etymology.description: 话(話) (huà, "words; speech; talk; language") — combines words with a phonetic suffix.
etymology.interpretation: This character intuitively connects the concept of 'words' with a sound component that suggests speaking. The visual representation reinforces the idea of communication through speech.
etymology.simplification: Stroke reduction was used to streamline the character. The semantic component 言(言) (yán, "word") remains intact, while the phonetic part was simplified.

examples.chinese: 请你说话(請你說話)，我想听(我想聽)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng nǐ shuōhuà, wǒ xiǎng tīng.
examples.english: Please speak, I want to listen.

examples.chinese: 他的语言(他的語言)非常丰富(非常豐富)。
我们正在讨论(我們正在討論)这个话题(這個話題)。
